key_risks: Financial volatility due to downward revision of fiscal 2025 adjusted EBITDA forecast
High competitive pressures from major players like Disney, Warner Bros., and Netflix
Reliance on licensing content to streaming platforms, leading to dependency risks
Production delays and theatrical performance uncertainty
controversies: Scrutiny over executive compensation and governance practices
Transparency and alignment with shareholder interests remain areas of focus
social_issues: Shifting consumer preferences affecting theatrical performance
governance_issues: Corporate governance concerns, including executive compensation and transparency

sources.title: Lions Gate Entertainment Corporation -- Company History
sources.snippet: Lions Gate Entertainment Corporation was founded by financier Frank Giustra in the summer of 1997. Giustra, the son of a Sudbury, Ontario nickel miner, had served previously as CEO of Yorkton Securities, Inc., an investment bank that specialized in funding mining ventures. ... Giustra and the corporate headquarters remained in Vancouver.

sources.title: S&P revises Lions Gate outlook to negative
sources.snippet: S&P Global Ratings revised its outlook on Lions Gate Entertainment Corp. to negative and affirmed all its ratings, including its B issuer credit rating, on the company. The negative outlook reflects the risk that ongoing delays in film and TV production could continue beyond mid-2020 due to negative social impacts from COVID-19.
